snippet: The case of a Yemeni citizen, who was held in the American prison in Cuba for years yet never charged with a crime, is a disgrace to the United States government.
abstract: Editorial describes the long imprisonment of Yemeni citizen Adnan Farhan Abdul Latif, who died in early September at the Guantanamo Bay Naval Base prison facility after being there for a decade; observes that when he died, he had not been charged with any crime or legal violation; contends that Guantanamo has tarnished American justice since the very day of its existence.
lead_paragraph: The case of a Yemeni citizen, who was held in the American prison in Cuba for years yet never charged with a crime, is a disgrace to the United States government.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
